meanings.definition: A large, clumsy, or unwieldy boat or ship.
meanings.sent1: The old hulk creaked in the water.
meanings.sent2: The hulk of the ship loomed in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The hulk of a boat tried to dance but tripped over its own waves.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned hulk of the ship was a ghostly reminder of its former glory.
meanings.sent5: The hulk of the vessel was so massive it blocked out the sun.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is bulky or unwieldy.
meanings.sent1: The wrestler was a hulk of a man, towering over everyone.
meanings.sent2: The hulk of a rock blocked the path.
meanings.sent3: The hulk of a sandwich was too big to fit in his mouth.
meanings.sent4: The hulk of a tree cast a long shadow over the garden.
meanings.sent5: The hulk of a bear lumbered through the forest, intimidating all who crossed its path.

meanings.sent1: He had to hulk his way through the thick mud.
meanings.sent2: The tired elephant began to hulk towards the watering hole.
meanings.sent3: The toddler tried to hulk across the room with a toy too big for him.
meanings.sent4: The wounded soldier hulked back to safety despite his injuries.
meanings.sent5: The exhausted hiker hulked up the steep mountain, one step at a time.
